intro: Bartsia santolinifolia, commonly known as the santolinifolia bartsia, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic plants. The plant typically has small, opposite leaves and produces clusters of pink or purple flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
